titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Samuel Herren, Bond
CWG5822

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We Samuel Herren principal & Azeriah Herren Security do bind ourselves three months after the date hereof to pay the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of Eighty two dollars and 07 cents, to bear interest at the rate of six per centum per annum, from this date until paid being the amount of principal and costs, of a capias profine which issued from the Clerks office of the Circuit Court of Grant County, on the 18th day of November 1863, in favor of the said Commonwealth of Kentucky, for the sum of $75.00 $ -- interest $4.4 costs of suit. $1.87 Sheriff's half commission, and 40 cents for this bond, amounting in the whole to the sum of $82.07 aforesaid, against the said Samuel Herren principal, and we the said Security A. Herren have hereby replevied the same. Witness our hands and seals, this 3d. day of Decr. 1863.

Jas. S. ^his X mark^ Herren
Azeriah ^his X mark^ Herren
att. John Marksbury S. G.C.

on the back of which is the following endorsement --
"Fifa issued March 4/64."
a copy att
N.H. Jeffers C. G. C. C.

Grant Cir Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Copy of Replevin Bond
Saml. Herren
Let the surety apply jointly for the exclusion & it will be gratis -- write to Summoners
